sections.subtitle: University Beginnings and Personal Growth
content: I began university in 2015, balancing academic life with various informal jobs to support myself. That stage helped me develop social skills, improve personal organization, and strengthen my discipline.

From 2019 to 2021, I worked in a call center across multiple business lines, including customer service and technical support. During that time, I gained hands-on experience with Amazon CMS platforms and Comcast telecommunications systems, building a strong foundation in system navigation, user empathy, and technical resolution.

sections.subtitle: Professional Transition and Technical Focus
content: In early 2022, I worked as a medical interpreter (English–Spanish), and later that year returned to customer service in the healthcare insurance sector. Once again, I worked with CMS platforms, refining my ability to communicate clearly, solve problems efficiently, and adapt to complex workflows.
By mid-2023, I shifted my full focus to university, deepening my technical expertise and sharpening my architectural vision.

sections.subtitle: First Project as a Developer
content: During my university years, I participated in social engagement projects. One of them involved developing a web system for a cooperative, which included account registration for clients and an access system for employees.

A controller was implemented for the cooperative’s leader, allowing them to view all changes made, identify which users executed them, and manage custom roles with specific permissions to access, edit, or view different sections of the system.
My main role in this project was front-end development, working with technologies like Nest.js and Laravel, focusing on the interface, user experience, and backend integration.

sections.subtitle: Professional Internship at STI Globals
content: My professional internship took place at STI Globals, a small development company where I worked mainly with React, Node.js, and Kotlin.
I contributed to the development of a mobile application using React Native, a POS system working on the payment infrastructure and transaction history display.

I also collaborated on the complete redesign of the company’s new website, which has not yet been implemented. In this last project, I was primarily responsible for the front-end, executing all requested changes from scratch.

sections.subtitle: Technical Specialization
content: I currently specialize in modular front-end development using Angular, SCSS, React, Node.js, and Kotlin. I'm passionate about clean code, responsive design, and building scalable components that align with both technical and narrative standards.
Every decision I make—whether in layout, logic, or documentation—is guided by clarity, maintainability, and purpose.
